What would you like to do next?
Hacker built this wall out of boulders!
You'll need to build a cave crasher to smash through it.
Looks like Buzz and Delete helped Hacker build this wall out of donuts!
Can you find the parts to chomp through it?
Hacker built this wall out of Funky Flowers from Jungolia!
You'll need the parts to cut through the flowers - and the stinky smell!
Hacker built this wall out of ice!
You need to find the parts to melt through it.
Hacker built this wall out of logs from Camptopia!
You'll need to find the parts to slice through it.
Hacker built this wall out of metal like the Grim Wreaker!
Can you find the parts to crash through it?
West
Remember! You need to enter both a letter and a number to move.
Skip intro
I need your help!
My famous cactus apple juice is Digit’s favorite drink
- he looks forward to it every summer!
But this year we haven’t had any cactus apples
because there haven’t been any bats!
Every year the bats pollinate my cactus plants
carrying pollen from flower to flower to help the cactus apples grow.
We need the bats to pollinate the plants to keep our ecosystem healthy!
Turns out that Hacker is behind this bat-tastrophe.
He’s terrified of bats and trapped them in a bunch of caves so they can’t get out to pollinate.
Can you help the CyberSquad rescue the bats
and help my cactus apples grow again?
Your mission is to navigate through different caves to free the bats.
For each cave, you must collect three parts for a machine that can break through a wall Hacker built.
It's too dark to see in the caves, but you can do something that bats do,
and even some people who are blind. It's called echolocation.
You can send out sounds and use the echoes that bounce back
to locate the objects you need to free the bats.

You found a battery pack.
Let's practice using echolocation to find an object!
You can use the arrow keys, click, tap, or swipe to move.
Now try moving one space east, to B1!
(B,1) are the coordinates that tell us the exact location of that space.
It’s almost like the name of that space.
Now, you'll send a ping!
You can send it North, East, South, or West!
Let’s send a ping East.
Select E to send the ping East.
An echo bounced back! That means your ping hit an object.
It just might be a part of the cave crasher you need.
When you send a ping, you lose a little battery life.
No battery life means you can't send pings.
Move 3 squares to the East, to (E, 1).
That’s where your ping hit an object.
On this level, you'll move by entering coordinates.
Remember, coordinates are the letter and number that tell us a location on the grid.
You won't be able to move with the arrow keys or mouse.
Find the letter space and click, tap, or type in the letter.
Find the number space and click, tap, or type in the number.
Good job! Now that you’ve entered the coordinates,
you will move to that square automatically

Text Color
Change the color of words and numbers on your screen.
To go to the settings for text color, press tab. When you find a selection you would like to use, press the enter button.
Text Size
Change the size of words and numbers on your screen.
To go to the settings for text size, press tab.
To hear me explain this control, press ENTER.
Turn the background picture on or off.
To go to the settings for background art, press tab. When you find a selection you would like to use, press the Enter button.
Choose to read along with what I’m saying.
To turn captions on or off, go to the Captioning settings by pressing tab. To change the setting, press the Enter button.
Choose which sound effect type you would like.
To choose a sound effect type, go to the sound effects options by pressing tab. To change to a different sound, select another option, then press the Enter button.
Choose how loud or quiet the music, sound effects, and voices are.
To move through the audio controls press tab.
Complete the game before the battery pack runs out, or choose to play with unlimited chances.
To choose whether you'd like to play with a battery pack, go to the battery pack settings by pressing tab. You can choose Play with Battery Pack or Play with Unlimited Chances with the Enter button.
To change the movement controls, go to the movement settings by pressing tab, then press the Enter button to activate a different option.
Choose to play with or without coordinates.
To choose your hints, go to the hints settings by pressing tab. You can activate the option with the Enter button.
Choose whether you'd like to play with no hints, some hints, or extra hints.
To hear more explanations by me, turn them on or off here.
To go to the settings for audio description, press tab. When you find a selection you would like to use, press the Enter button.
Then choose between the options by using tab.
To move through the settings with your keyboard, press tab.
And to select an option, press ENTER.
Let's tally up your score. You've rescued
bats.
bats are still trapped in the cave.
If you want to change your game setup,
find the Settings button and click, tap, or press enter to change the game settings.
If you need help, find the Get a Hint button and click, tap, or press enter to get a hint.
On your screen, buttons appear over an image of a dark cave.
A long, horizontal rectangle appears in the middle of your screen.
It is divided into a grid of twelve squares,
with two rows of six squares each.
The bottom row is labeled with the number 1 and the top row with the number 2.
Along the bottom of the rectangle, letters A, B, C, D, E, F mark the six columns.
Jackie appears in square (A, 1).
Press the right arrow key to move Jackie to the (B, 1) square.
A battery life indicator displays in the top left of the screen.
Skip, Settings, and Get a Hint buttons are at the bottom right of your screen.
A compass with North, South, East, West, appears inside a Ping button on the right side of your screen, with a Pick Up button below it.
A white hand on the screen points at the square to the right of (A, 1).
Press the right arrow key to move Jackie one space, to the (B, 1) square.
A white hand on the screen points at East inside the compass.
After sending the ping, your battery life indicator changes from 20 to 19.
Now, a white hand points to the (E, 1) square.
Now, a white hand points to the “Pick Up” button underneath the compass toward the bottom right of your screen.
When you reach the “pick up” button, press your enter key.
A battery life indicator displays in the top left of the screen.
A Coordinates box is positioned underneath the Parts to Find box, with the Send Ping box below it.
Number 1 marks the grid’s bottom row,
with numbers 2, 3, and 4 moving up the grid to label the other rows.
Number 1 marks the grid’s bottom row,
with numbers 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 moving up the grid to label the other rows.
Number 1 marks the grid’s bottom row,
with numbers 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, and 9 moving up the grid to label the other rows.
A large grid divided into 16 squares fills a big box along the left side of your screen.
Now the large grid is divided into 36 squares on the left side of your screen.
Now an even larger grid is divided into 81 squares on the left side of your screen.
Letters A, B, C, and D run left to right along the bottom of the grid labeling the columns.
Letters A, B, C, D, E, and F run left to right along the bottom of the grid labeling the columns.
Letters A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, and I run left to right along the bottom of the grid labeling the columns.
Jackie appears inside the (A, 1) square in the bottom left.
Go back a level - rescue
Try the next level - rescue
Replay the same level - rescue
Another night without bats!
So many apple cactus flowers, but only one apple to show for them.
Where are you, bats? Where oh where have you gone?
With your help, the bats returned to my garden to pollinate my cactus apple plants.
(Bats squeaking)
Go, bats, go!
Brigit, singing: When your thirst is on the loose -
All, singing: Try Brigit's cactus apple juice!
Digit: Ha ha!
Brigit stands in front of her garden full of blooming cactus plants,
covered with purple flowers and pointy spines.
Brigit is a pink cyberbird. She wears denim overalls.
She tallies a bat count in a calendar.
A Back button and a Next button are at the bottom center of the screen.
When they drink the nectar, they carry pollen from flower to flower.
Over time, the pollinated flowers turn into cactus apples.
Now, I can make my cactus apple juice again
thanks to you, and the bats.
Switch Access
Dwell on an item to activate it. Control the game without clicking.
Mission Accomplished!
Well done! You rescued all 105 bats!
Oh, dear. You ran out of battery!
End the Mission
Rescue More Bats
Nice job! Your machine crashed through Hacker's wall of boulders!
Awesome work! Your device melted through Hacker's wall of ice!

Way to go! Your device sawed through Hacker's wall of logs!
Terrific job! Your machine cut through Hacker's wall of funky flowers!
Amazing! Your device drilled through Hacker's wall of metal!
Echo Explorers
Great job!
You did it!
Nice work!
Keep searching for parts to help free the bats!
You can do it!
Keep going! The bats need your help!
Dwell on an item to activate it with an eye tracking or head tracking device.
In the Echo Explorers game, Jackie, Matt, Inez, and Brigit
stand in a dim, rocky cave. Bats fly above.
An orange, rectangular “Play” button is located at the bottom right of the image
and a “Set Up My Game” button is on the bottom left.
A 'Switch Access' on/off switch is located at the top right of your screen.
An 'Info' button is to the right of the switch.
Use your cursor to move around the controls or press your tab button to toggle through the options.
When you want to activate an individual button, press 'Enter.'
Get information about this screen.
You can adjust different game settings to choose how you would like to play.
You can click or tap the settings you want to adjust, or use your keyboard.
To move through the settings with your keyboard, press tab, and to select an option, press enter.
When you are ready to start, find the Play button.
There are three groups of settings that adjust different parts of the game.
Select the group you would like to adjust.
Screen setup and Audio Description.
Choose how the text and pictures on your screen look, and turn audio description on or off.
Sounds and Captioning.
Adjust the sound effects, music, and my voice, and turn closed captions on or off.
Difficulty Levels and Hints.
Adjust the difficulty of the game, and choose how often you get hints.
You can choose different parts of the game to adjust, like the audio levels, text size, and hints.
Select Play when you’re ready to start.
Three large buttons appear on your computer screen.
Move your cursor or tab to find your options for the game.
Under the three rectangular buttons, the Play button is at the bottom center.
The Reset and Info buttons are at the bottom right of your screen.
Difficulty levels, Hints, and Controls.
Adjust the difficulty of the game, choose how often you get hints, and choose how you control the game.
Screen setup and audio description.
Choose how the text and pictures on your screen look, and turn audio description on or off.
To edit this setting, press enter.
Sounds and Captioning.
Adjust the sound effects, music, and voices, and turn closed captions on or off.
Adjust the settings, or choose Play to start your mission.
Add a battery pack challenge to the game!
Dwell on an item to activate it with an eye tracking or head tracking device.
To choose whether you'd like to play in dwell mode,
go to the dwell setting by pressing tab.
You can choose Switch Access on or off with the enter button.

On the right side of your screen, Hacker frightfully gazes at a bat flying overhead.

The chart tallies how many bats you've rescued and how many bats are still trapped in the caves.

The chart tallies how many bats you've rescued and how many bats are still trapped in the cave system.
Two buttons appear at the bottom center of your screen.
The button on the left reads 'End the Mission' and the 'Rescue More Bats' button on the right pulses.

Now a furry gray bat flies next to a skwakpad.
Behind the skwakpad, towering rocks form pillars, and more bats fly in the distance.
Rectangular buttons appear on the skwakpad in the middle of the screen,
to allow you to select your next level.

and NO tally marks are in the 'trapped' column.

A huge colony of bats flies overhead in the night sky!
Pollen sticks to the fur around a bat's mouth as it drinks nectar from a blooming flower.
Flower petals on a pollinated flower slowly shrink and form into a ripened fruit!
Brigit flies a tray of glasses filled with her cactus apple juice to Jackie, Matt, Inez, and Digit!
The friends raise their glasses then drink Brigit's cactus apple juice!
